p: Transcription activator-like effectors (TALEs) are crucial virulence factors that function as transcriptional activators in the cell nucleus of plants, where they directly bind to DNA via a central domain of tandem repeats [ 53]. Currently, TALENs were shown to be an effective tool for precise genome engineering with low toxicity and could be engineered to adapt for an antiviral strategy [ 54]. Hence, TALENs are likely to become part of a new approach for the treatment of CMV infections.
